```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
```



```{r}
ec <- read_rds("ec.rds")
```

```{r}
summary(ec)
```

```{r}
# my county
ec |> 
  filter(county_name == "Franklin, Ohio")
```


```{r}
# could do x = log(x = pop2018)
ec |> 
  drop_na() |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = pop2018, y = ec_county)) +
    geom_point() +
    geom_smooth(method = "lm", formula = y ~ x, se = FALSE) +
    scale_x_log10() + 
    labs(title = "Economic Connectedness (EC) of US Counties, by Population", 
         subtitle = "No correlation between population and EC", 
         x = "Population", 
         y = "EC Score")
```

```{r}
# trying to create a relationship variable and graph it, is not working as of now.

ec |> 
  drop_na() |> 
  mutate(ec_population = pop2018 / ec_county) |> 
  arrange(desc(ec_population)) |>
```
